Container.Name: VoidAuth
Container.Overview: VoidAuth is an open-source authentication platform that streamlines user management and access control for self-hosted applications. Centered on OpenID Connect (OIDC) integration, it also offers first class support for Proxy ForwardAuth (ProxyAuth). With a focus on an intuitive end-user and administrator web interface, VoidAuth provides a seamless and professional authentication experience.

Config.Name: Web UI Port
Config.Description: Container Port: 3000

Config.Name: App URL
Config.Description: URL VoidAuth will be served on. Must start with https://

Config.Name: Default Redirect
Config.Description: The home/landing/app url for your domain. This is where users will be redirected upon accepting an invitation, logout, or clicking the logo when already on the auth home page. Will default to App URL if not provided.

Config.Name: Allow Registration
Config.Description: Allow new users to self-register themselves without invitation.

Config.Name: Registration Requires Approval
Config.Description: Whether new users who register themselves require approval by an admin. Setting this to false while SIGNUP is true enables open self-registration; use with caution!

Config.Name: Enable Email Verification
Config.Description: If true, users must have an email address and will get a verification email when changing their email address before it can be used. If you are using an email provider, this should be set to true.

Config.Name: App Title
Config.Description: Title that will show on the web interface, use your own brand/app/title.

Config.Name: App Color
Config.Description: Theme color in hex format

Config.Name: Contact Email
Config.Description: The email address used for 'Contact Us' links, which are shown on most end-user pages if this is set.

Config.Name: Database - Host
Config.Description: Host address of the Postgres database.

Config.Name: Database - Port
Config.Description: Port number of the Postgres database.

Config.Name: Database - Name
Config.Description: Name of the Postgres database.

Config.Name: Database - User
Config.Description: Username for the Postgres database.

Config.Name: Database - Password
Config.Description: Password for the Postgres database.

Config.Name: Storage Key - Primary
Config.Description: Storage encryption key for secret values such as keys and client secrets. Must be at least 32 characters long and should be randomly generated.

Config.Name: Storage Key - Secondary
Config.Description: Secondary storage encryption key, used when rotating the primary storage encryption key.

Config.Name: SMTP - Host
Config.Description: Hostname of the SMTP server to use for sending emails.

Config.Name: SMTP - Port
Config.Description: Port number of the SMTP server.

Config.Name: SMTP - Username
Config.Description: Username for authenticating with the SMTP server.

Config.Name: SMTP - Password
Config.Description: Password for authenticating with the SMTP server.

Config.Name: SMTP - From Address
Config.Description: Email address that emails will be sent from.

Config.Name: SMTP - Secure
Config.Description: Whether to use a secure connection (TLS) when connecting to the SMTP server.

Config.Name: App Data
Config.Description: Path to data directory

Config.Name: Password Strength
Config.Description: The minimum strength of users passwords, at least 3 is recommended.

Config.Name: Admin Emails
Config.Description: The minimum duration between admin notification emails. Can be set to values like: '4 hours', '30 minutes', 'weekly', 'daily', etc. If set to 'false', admin notification emails are disabled.

Config.Name: Internal App Port
Config.Description: Internal web interface port. Not recommended to change.
